thread.title: Celebrities React to Cubs Advancing to NLCS
thread.title_full: Celebrities React to Cubs Advancing to NLCS

title: Celebrities React to Cubs Advancing to NLCS
text: Chicago Baseball Celebrities React to Cubs Advancing to NLCS Although things got off to a rocky start, the boys in blue turned the game around and after the nail-biter fans and celebrities alike wasted no time taking to social media to express their excitement Celebrities React to Cubs Advancing to... Link Close Embed this video <script type="text/javascript" charset="UTF-8" src="http://www.nbcchicago.com/portableplayer/?cmsID=332586952&videoID=jEYkO78uJb1B&origin=nbcchicago.com&sec=news&subsec=sports&width=600&height=360"></script> More videos (1 of 9) « » Actor and longtime diehard Cubs fan John Cusack spoke to NBC 5's Peggy Kusinski after the Tuesday's win where he talked about going to his first game and what it's like to be among Chicago fans. (Published Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015) Thanks to late home runs from Anthony Rizzo and Kyle Schwarber, the Chicago Cubs beat the St. Louis Cardinals 6-4 on Tuesday night to advance to the NLCS for the first time since the 2003 season. Although things got off to a rocky start, the boys in blue turned the game around and after the nail-biter was over fans and celebrities wasted no time taking to social media to express their excitement in the unbelievable outcome. Congrats @Cubs - even @whitesox fans are rooting for you! — President Obama (@POTUS) October 14, 2015 Fly that motherfucking W. @Cubs — Nick Offerman (@Nick_Offerman) October 13, 2015 there's a light on in Chicago congrats @cubs ! https://t.co/rQQtNlLKrm — Fall Out Boy (@falloutboy) October 14, 2015 The crazy thing is gonna be five years from now when people say "I'm so sick of the Cubs winning all the time!"
